verses.text: Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Go down to the house of the king of Judah , and speak there this word ,
And say , Hear the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, O king of Judah , that sittest upon the throne of David , thou, and thy servants , and thy people that enter in by these gates :

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Execute ye judgment and righteousness , and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor : and do no wrong , do no violence to the stranger , the fatherless , nor the widow , neither shed innocent blood in this place.

For if ye do this thing indeed , then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of David , riding in chariots and on horses , he, and his servants , and his people.\f + \fr 22.4 \ft upon…: Heb. for David upon his throne\f*
But if ye will not hear these words , I swear by myself, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that this house shall become a desolation.

For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto the king’s house of Judah ; Thou \add art\add* Gilead unto me, \add and\add* the head of Lebanon : \add yet\add* surely I will make thee a wilderness , \add and\add* cities \add which\add* are not inhabited.
And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons : and they shall cut down thy choice cedars , and cast \add them\add* into the fire.
And many nations shall pass by this city , and they shall say every man to his neighbour , Wherefore hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* done thus unto this great city ?
Then they shall answer , Because they have forsaken the covenant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God , and worshipped other gods , and served them. \p
¶ Weep ye not for the dead , neither bemoan him: \add but\add* weep sore for him that goeth away : for he shall return no more, nor see his native country.

For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* touching Shallum the son of Josiah king of Judah , which reigned instead of Josiah his father , which went forth out of this place ; He shall not return thither any more:
But he shall die in the place whither they have led him captive , and shall see this land no more. \p
¶ Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness , and his chambers by wrong ; \add that\add* useth his neighbour’s service without wages , and giveth him not for his work ;

That saith , I will build me a wide house and large chambers , and cutteth him out windows ; and \add it is\add* cieled with cedar , and painted with vermilion.\f + \fr 22.14 \ft large: Heb. through-aired\f*\f + \fr 22.14 \ft windows: or, my windows\f*
Shalt thou reign , because thou closest \add thyself\add* in cedar ? did not thy father eat and drink , and do judgment and justice , \add and\add* then \add it was\add* well with him?
He judged the cause of the poor and needy ; then \add it was\add* well \add with him: was\add* not this to know me? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

But thine eyes and thine heart \add are\add* not but for thy covetousness , and for to shed innocent blood , and for oppression , and for violence , to do \add it\add*.\f + \fr 22.17 \ft violence: or, incursion\f*

Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah ; They shall not lament for him, \add saying\add*, Ah my brother ! or, Ah sister ! they shall not lament for him, \add saying\add*, Ah lord ! or, Ah his glory !
He shall be buried with the burial of an ass , drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem. \p
¶ Go up to Lebanon , and cry ; and lift up thy voice in Bashan , and cry from the passages : for all thy lovers are destroyed.

I spake unto thee in thy prosperity ; \add but\add* thou saidst , I will not hear. This \add hath been\add* thy manner from thy youth , that thou obeyedst not my voice.\f + \fr 22.21 \ft prosperity: Heb. prosperities\f*
The wind shall eat up all thy pastors , and thy lovers shall go into captivity : surely then shalt thou be ashamed and confounded for all thy wickedness.

O inhabitant of Lebanon , that makest thy nest in the cedars , how gracious shalt thou be when pangs come upon thee, the pain as of a woman in travail !\f + \fr 22.23 \ft inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress\f*
\add As\add* I live , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand , yet would I pluck thee thence;

And I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life , and into the hand \add of them\add* whose face thou fearest , even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon , and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
And I will cast thee out , and thy mother that bare thee, into another country , where ye were not born ; and there shall ye die.
But to the land whereunto they desire to return , thither shall they not return.\f + \fr 22.27 \ft desire: Heb. lift up their mind\f*

\add Is\add* this man Coniah a despised broken idol ? \add is he\add* a vessel wherein \add is\add* no pleasure ? wherefore are they cast out , he and his seed , and are cast into a land which they know not?
O earth , earth , earth , hear the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Write ye this man childless , a man \add that\add* shall not prosper in his days : for no man of his seed shall prosper , sitting upon the throne of David , and ruling any more in Judah.
